p: Tungsten trioxide (WO 3) is a well-known material studied for many years for its applications in gas sensing [ 1, 2], electrochromism [ 3, 4, 5, 6], photochromism [ 7, 8, 9, 10], and photocatalysis [ 11, 12]. It was recently shown [ 13] that oxygen sub-stoichiometry in tungsten oxide (with WO 3-x chemical composition) can have a strong impact on the optical properties on its optical properties.
